hanzi-su-wiki:
緊

Значения

Срочный, напряжённый

Мнемоника

Перевязывать 糸 туго и крепко. Сверху — туго: держать под контролем 又 чиновников 臣, имеющих дело с финансами.

Варианты

紧
purpleculture_pinyin:
jǐn
tight; strict; close at hand; near; urgent; tense; hard up; short of money; to tighten
в обтяжку; строгий; под рукой; возле; срочный; напряженный; тяжело; мало денег; затянуть

heisig_chinese_memo: Whenever Venom is tense and tight, he loses control of his sex drive and becomes a slave to his crotch.
heisig_constituent: tense, loincloth, retainer, slave, crotch, thread, spiderman
koohiiStory1: Whenever Venom is tense, he loses control of his sex drive and becomes a slave to his crotch.
koohiiStory2: You´d be tense too if you were a slave and your owner removed the threads covering your crotch.
jp_example_words:
緊急(きんきゅう): urgent, pressing, emergency
緊張(きんちょう): tension, mental strain, nervousness
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The servant sits on a stool, holding a piece of thread, looking very tense.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: You walk by this tense servant and pause for a moment. They raise their tense eyes up at you and you can see they're shaking.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You ask the servant why they're so tense, and they say they've been assigned to assassinate the King (きん) of England with this piece of thread.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine how tense you would be if you were about to try to murder the King! Your entire body would tense up, maybe to the point that you wouldn't be able to actually go through with it.
Ru_Notes: Не путать: 繁 (しげる、ハン разросшийся, цветущий), 頻 (しきりに、ヒン часто, регулярно). В 繁 верхняя часть состоит из "многократно, постоянно" и "удар, движение" и означает "быстро, проворно", что в сочетании с "нитью" значит "проворный рост". В 緊 верхняя часть состоит из "слуга" и "рука", и означает "держать под контролем", а в сочетании с "нитью" значит "туго затягивать".
Ru_Radicals: 又 (опять), 小 (маленький), 幺 (короткая нить), 糸 (нить), 臣 (вассал)
Ru_trainchinese: jǐn: (прил/глаг) тугой, тесный; крепкий, прочный; близкий; следующий в быстрой последовательности; строгий; напряженный; стесненный (материально); срочный, неотложный; затягивать
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the hard (臤) thread (糸) is tight
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Foiled again by your teeth, you floss has broken because it wasn't strong enough to get through that tight space between your teeth.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " blindness " to " silk ", the original meaning is the tension or tension of the string, which is opposite to " loose ". "Shuowen": "It's anxious to wind up the silk. From the embarrassment to the province." "Selected Works‧Fu Yi <Dancing Fu>": "Relax the urgent strings, and slow the last things."

" Tight " can generally refer to a state of tension. Southern Dynasties Liang Jiangyan's Miscellaneous Poems·Liu Wenxue·Sentimental Encounter: "How tight is the frost and dew, Gui Zhi is born straight."

" Tight " also means firmness and firmness. "Guan Zi·Q": "The hook string is made, the halberd is tight, how strong is it?" Yin Zhizhang's note: "Tight, it is said to be strong."

" Tight " also means austerity. "Suwen·Qi Interchange": "The West produces dryness, dryness generates gold, its morality is clean, its transformation is tight, its politics is intense." Wang Bing's note: "Tighten, shrink."

" Tight " also means urgency and urgency. "Two Moments Pai An Surprise" Volume 20: "Pretending to be dressed up and said: "To discuss, go to discuss! The government is tight, I have to go elsewhere.""

" Tight " also means important. "The Romance of the Three Kingdoms" Chapter 49: "Xu Sheng said: "Please stay less temporarily, if you have something to say.""

" Tight " also refers to close proximity and closeness. "Jing Shi Tong Yan-Cui Ya Nei White Harrier Recruits Demons": "The wind rustles in Maoye, and the shadows of the tight branches and moon are heavy."

" Tight " is also used as an adverb to express very or very. The third fold of Yuan Li Haogu's "Zhang Sheng Zhuhai": "The big worm who only heard shouted: "Why am I so distressed today?"
humanum_short_description_en: From " blind ", from " silk " to save, the original meaning is the tension or pressure of the silk string, as opposed to " loose ".
humanum_full_description:
從「臤」，從「絲」省，本義為絲弦受拉力或壓力後呈現的緊張狀態，與「鬆」相對。《說文》：「纏絲急也。从臤从絲省。」《文選‧傅毅〈舞賦〉》：「弛緊急之弦張兮，慢末事之委曲。」

　　「緊」可泛指緊張狀態。南朝梁江淹《雜體詩‧劉文學‧感遇》：「霜露一何緊，桂枝生自直。」

　　「緊」亦表示堅實、牢固。《管子‧問》：「鉤弦之造，戈戟之緊，其厲何若？」尹知章注：「緊，謂其堅彊者。」

　　「緊」也表示緊縮。《素問‧氣交變大論》：「西方生燥，燥生金，其德清潔，其化緊斂，其政勁切。」王冰注：「緊，縮也。」

　　「緊」還表示急促、迫切。《二刻拍案驚奇》卷二十：「承局打扮的道：『要商量，快去商量！府中限緊，我還要到別處去。』」

　　「緊」也指重要。《三國演義》第49回：「徐盛曰：『請暫少住，有緊話說。』」

　　「緊」還指距離近、密接無間。《警世通言‧崔衙內白鷂招妖》：「茂葉風聲瑟瑟，緊枝月影重重。」

　　「緊」亦用作副詞，表示很、甚。元李好古《張生煮海》第三摺：「只聽的大蟲叫道：『我今日怎麼這等心疼的緊。』」
humanum_short_description: 從「臤」，從「絲」省，本義為絲弦受拉力或壓力後呈現的緊張狀態，與「鬆」相對。

①密切合攏，與“松”相對：擰緊。捆緊。
②靠得極近：緊鄰。
③使緊：把琴絃緊緊。
④事情密切接連着，時間急促沒有空隙：緊湊。緊密。緊縮。加緊。抓緊。
⑤形勢嚴重，關係重要：緊急。緊促。緊迫。緊要。
⑥不寬裕：緊俏。緊缺。

從「 臤 」，從「 絲 」省，本義為絲弦受拉力或壓力後呈現的緊張狀態，與「 鬆 」相對。《說文》：「纏絲急也。从臤从絲省。」《文選‧傅毅〈舞賦〉》：「弛緊急之弦張兮，慢末事之委曲。」 「 緊 」可泛指緊張狀態。南朝梁江淹《雜體詩‧劉文學‧感遇》：「霜露一何緊，桂枝生自直。」 「 緊 」亦表示堅實、牢固。《管子‧問》：「鉤弦之造，戈戟之緊，其厲何若？」尹知章注：「緊，謂其堅彊者。」 「 緊 」也表示緊縮。《素問‧氣交變大論》：「西方生燥，燥生金，其德清潔，其化緊斂，其政勁切。」王冰注：「緊，縮也。」 「 緊 」還表示急促、迫切。《二刻拍案驚奇》卷二十：「承局打扮的道：『要商量，快去商量！府中限緊，我還要到別處去。』」 「 緊 」也指重要。《三國演義》第49回：「徐盛曰：『請暫少住，有緊話說。』」 「 緊 」還指距離近、密接無間。《警世通言‧崔衙內白鷂招妖》：「茂葉風聲瑟瑟，緊枝月影重重。」 「 緊 」亦用作副詞，表示很、甚。元李好古《張生煮海》第三摺：「只聽的大蟲叫道：『我今日怎麼這等心疼的緊。』」
From " blindness" to " silk", the original meaning is the tension or tension of the string, which is opposite to " loose". "Shuowen": "It's anxious to wind up the silk. From the embarrassment to the province." "Selected Works‧Fu Yi": "Relax the urgent strings, and slow the last things." " Tight" can generally refer to a state of tension. Southern Dynasties Liang Jiangyan's Miscellaneous Poems·Liu Wenxue·Sentimental Encounter: "How tight is the frost and dew, Gui Zhi is born straight." " Tight" also means firmness and firmness. "Guan Zi·Q": "The hook string is made, the halberd is tight, how strong is it?" Yin Zhizhang's note: "Tight, it is said to be strong." " Tight" also means austerity. "Suwen·Qi Interchange": "The West produces dryness, dryness generates gold, its morality is clean, its transformation is tight, its politics is intense." Wang Bing's note: "Tighten, shrink." " Tight" also means urgency and urgency. "Two Moments Pai An Surprise" Volume 20: "Pretending to be dressed up and said: "To discuss, go to discuss! The government is tight, I have to go elsewhere."" " Tight" also means important. "The Romance of the Three Kingdoms" Chapter 49: "Xu Sheng said: "Please stay less temporarily, if you have something to say."" " Tight" also refers to close proximity and closeness. "Jing Shi Tong Yan-Cui Ya Nei White Harrier Recruits Demons": "The wind rustles in Maoye, and the shadows of the tight branches and moon are heavy." " Tight" is also used as an adverb to express very or very. The third fold of Yuan Li Haogu's "Zhang Sheng Zhuhai": "The big worm who only heard shouted: "Why am I so distressed today?"

緊字的基本解释

緊
jǐn
见“紧”。

緊字的汉语字典释义

[①]［jǐn］
［《廣韻》居忍切，上軫，見。］
“紧1”的繁体字。
(1)缠丝急。见《说文·臤部》。引申为物体受拉力或压力后呈现的紧张状态。与“鬆”相对。
(2)收束；紧缩。
(3)指经济不宽裕。
(4)急促；迫切。
(5)急躁。
(6)猛烈；激急。
(7)快速。
(8)紧要；重要。
(9)坚实，牢固。
(10)距离近；密接无间。
(11)很；甚。
(12)中医学脉象名。
(13)唐宋时州县等级名。一般按其所在地位的轻重、辖境大小和经济开发程度划分。

緊字的康熙字典解释

【未集中】【糸字部】　緊； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页929第08
【廣韻】【韻會】【正韻】?居忍切，音謹。【說文】纏絲急也。【博雅】糾也。【玉篇】紉也。【唐書·百官志】議定天下州府爲兩輔、六雄、十望、十緊，及上中下之差。　又【集韻】頸忍切，音胗。義同。○按《說文》在臤部，今倂入。

緊字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
緊字的起名意思

暂无。

tight
Basic explanation of words
tight
jǐn
See "tight".
tight
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［jǐn］
["Guangyun" Ju Renqie, Shang Zhen, see you. ]
Traditional Chinese characters for "压1".
(1) Anxious to wrap the thread. See "Said Wen·Chubu". The extension is the state of tension that an object exhibits after being subjected to tension or pressure. Contrast with "pine".
(2) Tightening; tightening.
(3) The economy is not well-off.
(4) Urgent; urgent.
(5) Impatient.
(6) Violent; agitated.
(7) Fast.
(8) Important; important.
(9) Solid and firm.
(10) The distance is close; the closeness is seamless.
(11) Very; very.
(12) The name of the pulse condition in Chinese medicine.
(13) The names of prefectures and counties in the Tang and Song Dynasties. They are generally divided according to their location, size of jurisdiction and degree of economic development.
tight

[Not concentrated] [Shizi Department] 　 tight; Kangxi strokes: 14; page number: page 929 to 08
[Guang Yun] [Rhyme Club] [Zheng Yun]? Ju Renqie, the sound is good. [Said the text] It's anxious to wrap the silk. [Bo Ya] Correct also. [Jade articles] Sewing also. [Tang Shu·Hundred Officials] It is agreed that the state capitals of the world shall be Liangfu, Liuxiong, Shiwang, Shijin, and the difference between upper, middle and lower.　[Jiyun] Neck-bearingly cut, sound 胗. The same meaning. ○According to "Suowen" in Yibu, I enter today.

jǐn
вм. 紧
Radicals: 臣, 又, 糸  (servant, stool, thread)
Meaning Mnemonic
The servant sits on a stool, holding a piece of thread, looking very tense.
You walk by this tense servant and pause for a moment. They raise their tense eyes up at you and you can see they're shaking.
Reading Mnemonic
You ask the servant why they're so tense, and they say they've been assigned to assassinate the King (きん) of England with this piece of thread.
Imagine how tense you would be if you were about to try to murder the King! Your entire body would tense up, maybe to the point that you wouldn't be able to actually go through with it.

В 繁 верхняя часть состоит из "многократно, постоянно" и "удар, движение" и означает "быстро, проворно", что в сочетании с "нитью" значит "проворный рост". В 緊 верхняя часть состоит из "слуга" и "рука", и означает "держать под контролем", а в сочетании с "нитью" значит "туго затягивать".
